abs.name: Bent-Leg V-UP
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs bent at a 90-degree angle.
Place your hands beside your head or extend them straight above your chest.
Simultaneously lift your upper body and bring your knees toward your chest, creating a 'V' shape with your torso and thighs.
Exhale as you contract and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Lower your upper body and legs back to the starting position without letting them touch the ground.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Crunch 2
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Place your hands across your chest or lightly behind your ears.
Tuck your chin slightly to maintain a neutral neck position.
Engage your core muscles and exhale as you lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Hold for a brief pause at the top of the movement.
Inhale as you slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position.
Focus on using your abdominal muscles throughout the entire movement.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Crunch
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place your hands lightly behind your head or across your chest.
Engage your core muscles and lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor throughout the movement.
Exhale as you contract upward and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Focus on a slow, controlled movement rather than using momentum.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Hip Extension
instructions: Lie face up on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Place your arms at your sides with palms facing down for stability.
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips off the ground.
Raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
Hold the position at the top for 1-2 seconds.
Lower your hips back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Pullin
instructions: Start in a plank position with your arms extended and hands directly under your shoulders.
Engage your core muscles tightly.
Pull your belly button in toward your spine as if trying to create a hollow in your midsection.
Hold this contracted position for 2-3 seconds.
Release slightly without completely relaxing your core.
Repeat the pulling motion in a controlled manner for the recommended repetitions.
Maintain proper breathing throughout the exercise.

abs.name: Bodyweight Scissor Kick
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your hands either under your glutes for support or by your sides.
Lift both legs slightly off the ground, keeping them straight.
Raise your right leg higher while keeping your left leg just a few inches off the ground.
Alternate by lowering your right leg while simultaneously raising your left leg.
Continue this scissor-like motion in a controlled manner.
Keep your lower back pressed against the floor throughout the movement.
Maintain a steady breathing pattern as you continue alternating legs.
Complete the recommended number of repetitions for each leg.

abs.name: Bodyweight Sit-UP
instructions: Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet secured flat on the floor.
Place your hands behind your head with elbows pointing outward, or cross them over your chest.
Engage your core muscles and lift your entire upper body off the floor.
Continue rising until your torso is perpendicular to the floor.
Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Exhale during the upward movement and inhale during the downward movement.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Toe Touch
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended straight up toward the ceiling.
Keep your legs together and perpendicular to the floor.
Extend your arms toward your feet, keeping them straight.
Engage your core and lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Reach toward your toes with your fingertips, trying to touch them if possible.
Lower your upper body back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Maintain the vertical position of your legs throughout the exercise.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Bodyweight Toe Touch 2
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended straight toward the ceiling.
Keep your arms extended straight above your chest.
Engage your core muscles and lift your shoulders and upper back off the floor.
Simultaneously lift your hands toward your feet while keeping your legs stationary.
Reach as far as you can toward your toes, focusing on contracting your abdominals.
Hold the position briefly at the peak of the contraction.
Lower your upper body back to the starting position with control.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Core Twist
instructions: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Lean back slightly to engage your core, keeping your back straight.
Lift your feet slightly off the ground for more challenge, or keep them on the ground for beginners.
Clasp your hands together in front of your chest or hold a light weight for added resistance.
Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your hands toward the floor beside your hip.
Return to center and then rotate to the left side.
Continue alternating from side to side in a controlled manner.
Maintain good posture and avoid using momentum to swing your body.
Complete the recommended number of repetitions on each side.

abs.name: Crunches
instructions: Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Place your hands lightly behind your head or across your chest.
Engage your abdominal muscles by drawing your navel toward your spine.
Curl your shoulders and upper back off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed into the ground.
Hold for a brief moment at the top of the movement.
Lower back down in a controlled motion without fully relaxing at the bottom.
Exhale as you curl up and inhale as you lower down.
Focus on quality contractions rather than quantity of repetitions.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Dumbbell Side Bends
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Hold a dumbbell in one hand, letting it hang at your side.
Place your free hand behind your head or on your hip.
Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise.
Bend sideways toward the side holding the dumbbell as far as comfortably possible.
Contract your obliques and return to the starting position.
Complete all repetitions on one side before switching the dumbbell to the other hand.
Avoid leaning forward or backward during the movement.
Maintain controlled breathing throughout the exercise.

abs.name: Flat Bench Lying Leg Raise
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your legs extended and your hands gripping the sides or top of the bench for support.
Keep your lower back pressed against the bench throughout the movement.
Engage your core and lift your legs together toward the ceiling, keeping them straight.
Raise your legs until they form approximately a 90-degree angle with your torso.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Lower your legs slowly back to the starting position without letting them touch the bench.
Exhale during the upward movement and inhale during the downward movement.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Hanging Leg Raises
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with a firm grip and arms fully extended.
Keep your shoulders engaged to protect from injury.
Maintain a slight posterior pelvic tilt to engage your lower abdominals.
Keeping your legs straight (harder) or slightly bent (easier), raise them in front of you.
Lift until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as possible with good form.
Hold briefly at the top position.
Lower your legs slowly and with control back to the starting position.
Avoid swinging or using momentum to raise your legs.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Incline Bench Sit-ups
instructions: Set up an incline bench at a 30-45 degree angle.
Position yourself on the bench with your feet secured under the foot pads.
Cross your arms over your chest or place hands lightly behind your head.
Start with your upper body lowered toward the floor.
Engage your core and lift your torso until it forms a straight line with your thighs.
Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position with control.
Keep your movements smooth and avoid using momentum.
Exhale during the upward movement and inhale during the downward movement.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Leg Raises
instructions: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and arms at your sides, palms facing down.
Press your lower back into the floor by engaging your core muscles.
Keeping your legs straight, raise them until they form a 90-degree angle with the floor.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Lower your legs slowly and with control without letting them touch the floor.
Maintain tension in your abdominals throughout the entire movement.
Avoid lifting your hips off the ground during the exercise.
For beginners, a slight bend in the knees is acceptable.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Rotating T Extension
instructions: Start in a push-up position with your arms fully extended and hands directly under your shoulders.
Engage your core to keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Shift your weight onto your left arm as you rotate your torso to the right.
Extend your right arm straight up toward the ceiling, creating a T-shape with your body.
Hold the position briefly while looking up at your extended hand.
Return to the starting push-up position with control.
Repeat on the opposite side, rotating to the left and extending your left arm.
Continue alternating sides for the recommended number of repetitions.
Focus on maintaining a stable core throughout the entire movement.

abs.name: Seated Jack Knife
instructions: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Lean back slightly to engage your core, keeping your back straight.
Extend your arms straight in front of you, parallel to the floor.
Simultaneously lift your feet off the floor and straighten your legs as you lean back further.
Your body should form a V-shape at the peak of the movement.
Hold this position briefly, focusing on the contraction in your abdominals.
Return to the starting position in a controlled manner without letting your feet touch the floor.
Keep your movements fluid and avoid using momentum.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Side Bridge
instructions: Lie on your side with your legs extended and feet stacked on top of each other.
Prop yourself up on your elbow with your forearm flat on the floor.
Align your elbow directly under your shoulder for proper support.
Engage your core and lift your hips off the floor, creating a straight line from your head to your feet.
Hold this position while breathing normally.
Keep your neck in a neutral position, aligned with your spine.
Hold for the recommended duration, typically 20-60 seconds.
Lower your hips back to the floor and repeat on the opposite side.
For beginners, you can modify by bending your bottom knee for additional support.

abs.name: Sit-Ups
instructions: Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Secure your feet under something heavy or have a partner hold them.
Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands lightly behind your ears.
Engage your core muscles and lift your entire upper body off the floor.
Continue rising until your torso is fully upright and perpendicular to the floor.
Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Exhale during the upward movement and inhale during the downward movement.
Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands if placed behind your head.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

abs.name: Superman
instructions: Lie face down on a mat with your arms extended in front of you and legs straight out behind you.
Keep your neck in a neutral position, with your eyes looking at the floor.
Simultaneously raise your arms, chest, and legs off the floor as high as comfortably possible.
Imagine you are flying like Superman, with your body forming a gentle curve.
Hold the contracted position for 2-3 seconds while squeezing your lower back muscles.
Lower your arms, chest, and legs back to the starting position with control.
Breathe naturally throughout the exercise, avoiding holding your breath.
Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions or hold for the suggested duration.
Focus on activating your erector spinae muscles along your spine throughout the movement.

abs.name: Twisting Hip Raise
instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended toward the ceiling and arms out to the sides for stability.
Keep your shoulders flat on the ground throughout the exercise.
Engage your core and lift your hips slightly off the floor.
Twist your hips to one side, lowering your legs about 45 degrees in that direction.
Keep your legs together and straight throughout the movement.
Return to the center position with your legs pointing toward the ceiling.
Twist to the opposite side, mirroring the movement.
Continue alternating sides in a controlled manner.
Focus on initiating the movement from your core, not your legs.
Complete the recommended number of repetitions on each side.

back.name: Back Extensions
instructions: Adjust the machine so that your thighs are supported on the pads and your hips are just beyond the edge.
Position yourself with your ankles secured under the footpads and your body straight with hands crossed over your chest or behind your head.
This will be your starting position.
Slowly bend forward at the waist as far as you can while keeping your back flat.
Slowly raise your torso back to the initial position as you maintain a straight back.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Barbell Shrugs
instructions: Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip (palms facing the body).
Make sure to keep your arms extended and your back straight. This is your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as possible.
Hold the contraction at the top for a second and then lower your shoulders back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Bent Over Row
instructions: Holding a barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing down), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward by bending at the waist.
Keep your back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor.
The bar should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.
While keeping the torso stationary, lift the barbell to your lower chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
On the top contracted position, squeeze your back muscles and hold for a brief moment.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Bodyweight Superman
instructions: Lie face down on a mat with your arms fully extended in front of you and your legs fully extended behind you.
This will be your starting position.
Simultaneously raise your arms, chest, and legs off the floor as high as possible.
Hold the contracted position for 2-4 seconds.
Slowly lower back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Chin-Ups
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with the palms facing your body (supinated grip) and a grip closer than shoulder width.
As you hang from the bar, pull your shoulder blades back and down to engage the lats. This will be your starting position.
Pull your body up until your chin clears the bar, focusing on using your back muscles to initiate the movement.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position with your arms fully extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Deadlifts
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell positioned over the middle of your feet.
Bend at the hip and knees, keeping your back straight and grabbing the bar with a shoulder-width grip.
Your arms should be just outside your legs, fully extended and perpendicular to the floor.
Keep your chest up and your core tight. This is your starting position.
Begin the movement by pushing through your heels while maintaining a flat back.
Keep the bar close to your body, extending your knees and hips simultaneously until you are standing upright.
Lower the weight by hinging at the hips and bending your knees, maintaining your back position.
Once the weights touch the ground, you've completed one repetition.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Dumbbell Push-up Row
instructions: Get into a push-up position with your hands grasping the handles of two dumbbells placed shoulder-width apart.
Your body should form a straight line from your head to your heels.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor.
Push back up to the starting position.
Once at the top, row one dumbbell up by pulling your elbow back and keeping it close to your body.
Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Perform another push-up and then row with the opposite arm.
Continue alternating sides for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Dumbbell Row
instructions: Place your right knee and hand on a flat bench to support your body.
Your left foot should be flat on the floor, and your back should be straight and parallel to the floor.
Grasp a dumbbell in your left hand with a neutral grip, letting it hang at arm's length.
This will be your starting position.
Pull the dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Squeeze your back muscles at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Complete the recommended number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat.

back.name: Dumbbell Shrugs
instructions: Stand erect with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging at your sides, palms facing your body.
Keep your back straight and your head up. This is your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as high as possible without moving any other body part.
Hold the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Lat Pull-Downs
instructions: Sit down on the pull-down machine with a wide bar attached to the top pulley.
Grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. The arms should be fully extended and the torso should be straight.
Pull the bar down until it touches your upper chest by drawing the shoulders and upper arms down and back.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
After a brief pause at the bottom, slowly return to the starting position with your arms fully extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: One-Arm Dumbbell Rows
instructions: Place your right knee and right hand on a flat bench for support.
Keep your left foot flat on the floor and pick up a dumbbell with your left hand.
Your back should be almost parallel to the floor, with the left arm hanging straight down holding the dumbbell.
This will be your starting position.
Keeping your back straight, pull the dumbbell up toward your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.
At the top of the movement, squeeze your back muscles.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Complete the recommended reps, then switch to the other arm.

back.name: Reverse Chin Ups
instructions: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you), hands shoulder-width apart.
Your arms should be fully extended. This is your starting position.
In this position, slowly lower yourself to count 4-5 seconds on the way down.
Once you reach the bottom position with arms fully extended, have a partner help you back up to the starting position, or jump back up to the starting position.
Repeat the controlled lowering phase for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Seated Bent Over Row
instructions: Sit on the end of a bench with your feet firmly planted on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other.
Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and letting your arms hang down perpendicular to the floor.
This will be your starting position.
Keeping your back stationary, lift the dumbbells toward your body by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows.
At the top of the movement, squeeze your back muscles.
Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: Seated Rows
instructions: Sit on the seated row machine with your feet on the footrests and knees slightly bent.
Grasp the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
Keep your back straight and pull the handles towards your torso.
Pull your shoulder blades back as you bring the bar toward your stomach.
Hold the contracted position for a moment as you squeeze your back muscles.
Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

back.name: T-Bar Bent Over Row
instructions: Load the appropriate weight onto the T-bar row machine.
Stand astride the bar and position yourself with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Bend over at the waist, keeping your back straight and almost parallel to the floor.
Grasp the handles with both hands.
This will be your starting position.
Pull the bar towards your lower chest by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position with arms extended.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Cable Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a cable curl bar that is attached to a low pulley.
Grab the cable bar at shoulder width using an underhand grip (palms facing up). Keep your elbows close to your torso.
The starting position: your arms should be fully extended and the bar should be at thigh level.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weight forward while contracting the biceps.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Concentration Curls
instructions: Sit down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand.
Spread your legs and place your feet firmly on the floor.
Lean forward and place the working arm against the inner thigh with the palm facing away from the leg.
The arm should be extended with the dumbbell held just above the floor.
This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arm stationary, curl the weight up by contracting your biceps.
Continue until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment while squeezing the biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, then switch arms.

biceps.name: Curls
instructions: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: EZ Curl Bar Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle.
The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar.
Keep your elbows close to your torso. This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Inhale and slowly begin to lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Hammer Grip
instructions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell in each hand being held at arms length.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso (neutral grip).
This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Incline Underhand Grip
instructions: Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Lean back against the bench and let your arms hang down at your sides, palms facing forward (supinated grip).
This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting your biceps.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Low Pulley Curl
instructions: Stand facing a low pulley machine with a straight bar attached to the cable.
Grab the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up) at shoulder width.
Stand up straight about 1-2 feet from the pulley with your arms fully extended and your feet shoulder width apart.
This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the bar up towards your shoulders.
Continue lifting until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment while squeezing your biceps.
Inhale and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Preacher Curls
instructions: Adjust the preacher bench seat so that your upper arms rest comfortably on the pad with your chest against it.
Grab the EZ bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up) at about shoulder width.
Rest your upper arms on the preacher bench pad with the triceps pressed against the pad and the elbows just over the edge.
Lower the bar until your arms are fully extended and the biceps are stretched.
This will be your starting position.
As you exhale, use your biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps are fully contracted.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Inhale as you slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

biceps.name: Underhand Grip On Bench
instructions: Sit on a flat bench with a straight barbell placed on your thighs.
Your hands should be about shoulder width apart using an underhand grip (palms facing up).
Lean back slightly and lift the barbell off your thighs until your arms are extended straight down with the barbell just above the floor.
This will be your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your torso, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps.
Inhale and slowly begin to lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder width apart with your palms facing forward.
Lift the bar off the rack and hold it straight over your chest with your arms fully extended. This is your starting position.
Inhale and slowly lower the bar until it touches your mid-chest.
Pause briefly, then exhale and push the bar back to the starting position by extending your arms.
Focus on using your chest muscles to push the weight, keeping your elbows at approximately a 45-degree angle to your body.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Bench Presses
instructions: Lie flat on the bench with your feet planted firmly on the floor.
Grasp the barbell with a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward.
Unrack the bar and position it directly above your chest with arms fully extended.
This is your starting position.
Lower the bar in a controlled manner by bending your elbows, keeping them at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Continue lowering until the bar lightly touches your chest at the nipple line.
Push the bar back up to the starting position by extending your arms and contracting your chest muscles.
Exhale as you push the weight up.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Cable Crossover Flys
instructions: Stand in the middle of a cable crossover machine with feet shoulder-width apart.
Grab the high pulley handles with both hands, palms facing down.
Take a small step forward to create tension in the cables, with arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
This is your starting position.
Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, bring your hands together in front of your chest in a wide arc motion.
Squeeze your chest muscles at the point of maximum contraction.
Hold for a brief pause, then slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Decline Pushup
instructions: Position yourself in a standard push-up position, but place your feet on a bench or elevated platform.
Your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the floor.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, with your core engaged.
This is your starting position.
Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Descend until your chest is about an inch from the ground.
Push yourself back to the starting position by extending your arms and contracting your chest muscles.
Exhale as you push up.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Diamond Pushup On Bench
instructions: Position yourself in front of a bench, with your hands placed on the bench in a diamond shape (index fingers and thumbs touching to form a diamond).
Extend your legs back so that your body forms a straight line from head to heels, with your weight on your toes.
Keep your core tight and your back straight. This is your starting position.
Inhale as you lower your chest toward the bench by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the bench.
Exhale as you push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Focus on contracting your chest and triceps throughout the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Dive Bomber Pushup
instructions: Start in a downward dog position with your hands and feet shoulder-width apart, forming an inverted V-shape with your body.
Your hips should be high, with your head between your arms. This is your starting position.
Begin by bending your elbows and lowering your shoulders, swooping your chest forward and down like you're diving under a bar.
Continue the forward motion, arching your back and bringing your chest up as your hips come close to the ground.
Your arms should be nearly straight at the end of this forward motion.
Reverse the movement by pushing your hips back up while lowering your chest, returning to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Dumbbell Decline Bench Press
instructions: Secure your legs at the end of a decline bench and lie down with a dumbbell in each hand.
Position the dumbbells at shoulder level, palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended above your chest. This is your starting position.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells in an arc motion until they are at chest level.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows to reduce stress on the joint.
Exhale and push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, contracting your chest muscles.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Dumbbell Flys
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in your elbows. This bend should remain constant throughout the movement.
This is your starting position.
Lower the weights in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest, keeping your arms relatively straight but not locked.
The dumbbells should be in line with your chest at the bottom of the movement.
Exhale and return to the starting position by contracting your chest muscles and bringing the dumbbells back together in an arc motion.
Squeeze your chest at the top of the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Dumbbell Presses
instructions: Lie on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on your thighs.
Use your thighs to help raise the dumbbells up to chest level, then position them at shoulder width with palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended above your chest, but don't lock out your elbows. This is your starting position.
Inhale and slowly lower the weights toward your chest, keeping your elbows at approximately a 45-degree angle to your body.
Lower until the dumbbells are at chest level.
Exhale and push the dumbbells back up to the starting position by extending your arms and contracting your chest.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Dumbbell Pullovers
instructions: Lie perpendicular on a flat bench, with only your upper back and shoulders in contact with the bench.
Plant your feet firmly on the floor with your knees bent at 90 degrees.
Hold a single dumbbell with both hands, palms pressed against the underside of one of the dumbbell plates.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in your elbows. This is your starting position.
While keeping your arms relatively straight and maintaining the bend in your elbows, inhale and lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head.
Continue lowering until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats, stopping before any discomfort.
Exhale and return the dumbbell to the starting position by contracting your chest, following the same arc path.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Incline Presses
instructions: Adjust an incline bench to an angle between 30 and 45 degrees.
Lie back on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the barbell with a grip slightly wider than shoulder width, palms facing forward.
Unrack the bar and hold it directly above your upper chest with arms fully extended. This is your starting position.
Inhale and slowly lower the bar to your upper chest, keeping your elbows at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Briefly touch the bar to your upper chest.
Exhale and push the bar back to the starting position by extending your arms and contracting your chest muscles.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Parallel Bar Dips
instructions: Mount yourself on parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body upright.
Cross your ankles behind you and lean forward at approximately a 30-degree angle to emphasize chest engagement.
This is your starting position.
Inhale and slowly lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
Keep your elbows pointed outward to target the chest more effectively.
Pause briefly at the bottom position.
Exhale and push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms and contracting your chest muscles.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Pec Deck Flies
instructions: Adjust the seat of the pec deck machine so that your upper arms are parallel to the floor when gripping the handles.
Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad and grasp the handles or place your forearms against the pads.
Keep your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle. This is your starting position.
Push the handles or pads together in front of your chest by contracting your chest muscles.
Squeeze your chest muscles at the point of maximum contraction.
Hold for a brief moment, then slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

chest.name: Push-up Touch
instructions: Begin in a standard push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Once your chest is close to the ground, push back up to the starting position.
At the top of the movement, lift your right hand and touch your left shoulder while maintaining balance.
Return your right hand to the floor and perform another push-up.
After the next push-up, lift your left hand and touch your right shoulder.
Continue alternating sides after each push-up for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Angled Leg Presses
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine with your back against the padded support.
Place your feet on the platform at shoulder-width apart, with toes slightly pointed outward.
Release the safety catches and grasp the handles alongside the seat for support.
Lower the platform by bending your knees until they form approximately a 90-degree angle.
Ensure your knees track in line with your toes and don't extend beyond them.
This is your starting position.
Push the platform away by extending your knees and hips, without locking your knees at the top.
Exhale as you push the weight up.
Slowly return to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Barbell Calf Raise
instructions: Place a block or step in front of you and position a loaded barbell across your upper back, resting it on your trapezius muscles.
Stand upright with your torso straight and the balls of your feet on the edge of the block, heels extending off.
This will be your starting position.
Raise your heels off the floor by contracting your calf muscles, lifting as high as possible.
Hold the contracted position for a moment at the top.
Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position, stretching your calves.
Inhale as you lower your heels and exhale as you raise them.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Barbell Squat
instructions: Position a barbell at upper chest height on a squat rack.
Step under the bar and position it across your upper back, resting on your trapezius muscles, not your neck.
Grasp the bar with a wider-than-shoulder-width grip for stability.
Lift the bar off the rack by straightening your legs and step back.
Position your feet shoulder-width apart with toes pointed slightly outward.
This is your starting position.
Begin the movement by inhaling and bending your knees and hips simultaneously, as if sitting back into a chair.
Keep your back straight, chest up, and knees tracking over your toes.
Continue until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below, depending on your flexibility and goals.
Exhale and push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your knees and hips.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Cable Back Kicks
instructions: Attach an ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and then secure it around your ankle.
Face the weight stack, holding onto the cable apparatus for support.
Keep your abs tight, back straight, and the knee of your working leg slightly bent.
This will be your starting position.
Keeping your leg slightly bent, extend your working leg to the rear by contracting your glutes.
Continue the movement until your leg is fully extended behind you.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment.
Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.

legs.name: Dumbbell Calf Raise
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides.
Place the balls of your feet on a block or step with your heels extending off.
Adjust your posture to be upright with your torso straight. This will be your starting position.
Raise your heels as high as possible by contracting your calf muscles.
Hold the contracted position at the top for a brief moment.
Slowly lower your heels below the level of the step, feeling a stretch in your calves.
Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Dumbbell Side Lunge
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and stand with your feet about shoulder-width apart.
Keep your back straight, chest up, and arms hanging at your sides. This is your starting position.
Take a wide step to the side with your right foot, keeping your toes pointed forward.
Bend your right knee and push your hips back, lowering your body while keeping your left leg straight.
Lower until your right thigh is parallel to the ground, with the dumbbells positioned near your right foot.
Push off with your right foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side by stepping out with your left foot.
Continue alternating sides for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Dumbbell Squats
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outward.
Keep your chest up, shoulders back, and your back straight. This is your starting position.
Begin the movement by bending your knees and hips simultaneously, as if sitting back into a chair.
Keep your knees tracking over your toes and your weight centered on the middle of your foot.
Lower your body until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as low as your flexibility allows with proper form.
Pause briefly at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Exhale as you stand up and inhale as you lower yourself.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Hack Squats
instructions: Position yourself on the hack squat machine with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads.
Place your feet on the platform at shoulder-width apart, with toes pointed slightly outward.
Release the safety stops and grasp the handles alongside the machine for support.
Straighten your legs without locking the knees. This is your starting position.
Slowly lower the platform by bending your knees until they form approximately a 90-degree angle.
Ensure your knees track over your toes and your back remains against the pad throughout the movement.
Push the platform back to the starting position by extending your knees and hips.
Exhale as you push the weight up and inhale as you lower it.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Leg Extensions
instructions: Sit on a leg extension machine with your back against the backrest and adjust the pad so it sits on top of your lower shin, just above your feet.
Grasp the side handles of the machine for support.
Ensure your knees are aligned with the machine's pivot point. This is your starting position.
Exhale and extend your legs to the maximum as you squeeze your quadriceps.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment at the top of the movement.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position without letting the weight stack touch down.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Seated Leg Curls
instructions: Adjust the seated leg curl machine to fit your body size and sit with your back against the backrest.
Place the back of your lower legs on top of the padded lever, a few inches below your calves.
Position your knees just beyond the edge of the seat and secure the lap pad against your thighs, just above the knees.
Grasp the handles on the machine for support.
This will be your starting position with your legs fully extended.
Exhale and pull the machine lever as far as possible toward the back of your thighs by flexing your knees.
Hold the contracted position for a brief moment and squeeze your hamstrings.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Single Leg Split Squat
instructions: Stand in a split stance with your right foot forward and left foot back, approximately 2-3 feet apart.
Your right foot should be flat on the ground, while your left foot is on the ball of the foot with the heel raised.
Keep your torso upright, core engaged, and hands on your hips or at your sides for balance.
This is your starting position.
Inhale and lower your body by bending both knees until your back knee almost touches the ground.
Your front knee should track over your toes and form a 90-degree angle at the bottom position.
Exhale and push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Complete all repetitions on one leg before switching to the other side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

legs.name: Toe Raises
instructions: Stand on a flat surface with your feet hip-width apart and toes pointing forward.
You may hold onto something stable for balance if needed, such as a wall or railing.
Keep your torso straight and core engaged. This is your starting position.
Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible by pushing through the balls of your feet.
Hold the contracted position at the top for a brief moment.
Slowly lower your heels back to the ground in a controlled manner.
Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them.
For added difficulty, you can perform this exercise on the edge of a step to increase range of motion.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Arnold Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support and hold two dumbbells in front of you at about upper chest level.
Your palms should be facing your body (supinated grip), and your upper arms should be close to your torso.
This will be your starting position.
Begin the movement by rotating your palms so they face forward as you press the dumbbells overhead.
Extend your arms fully overhead, keeping your head straight and looking forward.
After a brief pause at the top, begin to lower the dumbbells in a controlled manner.
As you lower the weights, rotate your palms back toward your body, returning to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Back Presses
instructions: Place a barbell on a rack at about shoulder height.
Step under the bar and position it on your rear deltoids, across your upper back.
Grasp the bar with a pronated (overhand) grip, wider than shoulder width.
Lift the bar off the rack by extending your knees and stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Keep your core tight and maintain a slight bend in your knees. This is your starting position.
Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms, keeping your elbows out to the sides.
Continue pressing until your arms are fully extended above your head.
Pause briefly at the top, then lower the barbell back to the starting position across your upper back in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Barbell Front Raises
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at thigh level.
Your hands should be positioned slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Maintain a slight bend in your elbows and keep your back straight. This is your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight, exhale and raise the barbell forward and upward until it reaches eye level.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Presses
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
Position the dumbbells with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent at about 90 degrees.
This is your starting position.
Exhale and push the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Keep your head straight and looking forward throughout the movement.
Pause briefly at the top, ensuring not to lock your elbows.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Dumbbell Rear Deltoid Raises
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
Bend forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
Allow the dumbbells to hang directly below your shoulders with your arms slightly bent.
This is your starting position.
Keeping the same slight bend in your elbows, exhale and raise the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Focus on using your rear deltoids to initiate and control the movement.
At the top of the movement, your arms should be perpendicular to your torso.
Pause briefly at the top and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Front Presses
instructions: Place a barbell on a rack at about shoulder height.
Approach the bar and grip it slightly wider than shoulder width with an overhand grip.
Step under the bar and position it on the front of your shoulders, crossing your arms to create a shelf with your deltoids.
Lift the bar off the rack by extending your knees and stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Your elbows should be pointing forward and up. This is your starting position.
Keeping your core tight and back straight, press the bar overhead by extending your arms.
Continue pressing until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Lower the barbell back to the front rack position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Front Raises
instructions: Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
Your palms should be facing your body.
Keep your back straight and your core engaged. This is your starting position.
Keeping your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, exhale and raise the dumbbells forward and upward until they reach eye level.
Your palms should continue facing downward throughout the movement.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Front Weight Raise
instructions: Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands at the bottom edge.
Hold the plate in front of your thighs with your arms extended and a slight bend at the elbows.
Keep your back straight and your core engaged. This is your starting position.
Exhale and raise the weight plate forward and upward, keeping your arms extended until the plate reaches eye level.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Inhale and slowly lower the weight plate back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Your palms should be facing your body.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows and maintain this position throughout the movement.
This is your starting position.
Exhale and raise the dumbbells out to the sides until they reach shoulder level, forming a 'T' with your body.
Your palms should face downward at the top of the movement, with the pinky side of your hand slightly higher than the thumb side (slight internal rotation).
Pause briefly at the top and focus on contracting your lateral deltoids.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Low-Pulley Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand sideways to a low pulley cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the cable handle with the hand farthest from the machine, palm facing inward.
Step away from the machine to create tension in the cable, holding the handle at your side, with your arm slightly bent.
Place your free hand on your hip or hold onto something stable for balance.
This is your starting position.
Exhale and raise your arm out to the side until it reaches shoulder level, keeping the same slight bend in your elbow.
Pause briefly at the top and focus on contracting your lateral deltoid.
Inhale and slowly lower your arm back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Complete all repetitions with one arm before switching to the other side.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Low Pulley Front Raises
instructions: Stand facing away from a low pulley cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Reach down and grasp the cable handle with an overhand grip (palms facing down).
Stand upright with the cable running between your legs, your arm extended with a slight bend in the elbow.
This is your starting position.
Keeping your arm straight with a slight bend in the elbow, exhale and raise the handle forward and upward until it reaches eye level.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Inhale and slowly lower the handle back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Complete all repetitions with one arm before switching to the other.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Low Pulley Front Raises 2
instructions: Stand facing away from a low pulley cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp the cable handle with both hands, using an overhand grip (palms facing down).
Stand up straight with your arms fully extended and the cable between your legs.
Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement. This is your starting position.
Exhale and raise the handle forward and upward in a wide arc until your arms are parallel to the floor (at shoulder level).
Pause briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on contracting your front deltoids.
Inhale and slowly lower the handle back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Pec Deck Rear-Delt Laterals
instructions: Adjust the seat of a pec deck machine so that when seated, your chest is against the back pad.
Sit facing the padded side of the machine (reverse of how you would sit for chest flyes).
Grasp the handles with your arms extended in front of you.
This will be your starting position.
Exhale and pull the handles out to your sides in a wide arc by contracting your rear deltoids.
Continue the movement until your upper arms are approximately parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the point of maximum contraction.
Hold the contracted position briefly.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

shoulders.name: Upright Rows
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing your body) at thigh level.
Your hands should be positioned slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
Keep your back straight and your core engaged. This is your starting position.
Exhale and pull the barbell vertically up along your body to chest level, leading with your elbows.
Your elbows should point outward and remain higher than your wrists throughout the movement.
The bar should be close to your body during the lift.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on squeezing your deltoids and traps.
Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
Note: Maintain moderate width grip position to reduce shoulder impingement risk.

triceps.name: Barbell Triceps Extension
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your head at one end.
Grasp a barbell with a close grip (hands about 8-12 inches apart) and extend your arms so the bar is directly above your chest.
Keep your elbows in and pointed toward your feet. This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, inhale and slowly lower the barbell by bending your elbows until the bar is just above your forehead.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Exhale and extend your arms to push the barbell back to the starting position, focusing on contracting your triceps.
Keep your elbows pointed upward and maintain control throughout the movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Bench Dip
instructions: Position two benches parallel to each other, about 3-4 feet apart.
Sit on one bench and place your hands beside your hips, fingers pointing forward and gripping the edge of the bench.
Extend your legs and rest your heels on the other bench, keeping your legs straight.
Slide your buttocks off the bench with your arms extended. This is your starting position.
Lower your body by bending your elbows to about 90 degrees, keeping your back close to the bench.
Keep your elbows pointed behind you, not out to the sides.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows, focusing on contracting your triceps.
For beginners, you can keep your feet on the floor with knees bent at 90 degrees instead of elevated on a bench.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Diamond Pushup
instructions: Get into a push-up position on the floor with your hands close together directly under your chest.
Position your index fingers and thumbs to touch each other, forming a diamond or triangle shape.
Extend your legs back with your feet together or slightly apart, balancing on your toes.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, with your core engaged. This is your starting position.
Inhale and lower your chest toward your hands by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
Continue lowering until your chest nearly touches your hands.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Exhale and push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows, focusing on contracting your triceps.
Keep your body straight throughout the entire movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: One Arm Reverse Pushdown
instructions: Stand facing a high pulley cable machine with a single handle attachment.
Grasp the handle with an underhand grip (palm facing up).
Stand upright with a good posture, feet shoulder-width apart, and knees slightly bent.
Position your working arm so the upper arm is close to your side and parallel to the floor, with the elbow bent at 90 degrees. This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and push the handle down by extending your elbow until your arm is fully extended.
Focus on contracting your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
Pause briefly in the fully extended position.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner, allowing your elbow to bend to 90 degrees.
Complete all repetitions with one arm before switching to the other arm.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Push-Up Grip Planche
instructions: Start in a standard push-up position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Rotate your hands so your fingers point outward (away from your body) at approximately a 45-degree angle.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, with your core engaged.
Lean forward, shifting your weight toward your hands and shoulders, creating a forward lean. This is your starting position.
Inhale and bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Maintain the forward lean throughout the movement.
Lower until your chest is a few inches from the floor.
Exhale and push back up to the starting position by extending your elbows and contracting your triceps.
Maintain body alignment and the forward lean throughout the exercise.
For advanced practitioners, try to gradually increase the forward lean to work toward a full planche position.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Seated Triceps Extension
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell with both hands.
Raise the dumbbell overhead at arm's length, with your palms facing up supporting the underside of the weight (diamond grip).
Keep your upper arms close to your head with your elbows pointing forward. This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, inhale and lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Continue the movement until your forearms touch your biceps.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Exhale and raise the dumbbell back to the starting position by extending your elbows, focusing on contracting your triceps.
Maintain control throughout the entire movement.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Single Arm Triceps Extension
instructions: Stand upright or sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in one hand.
Raise the arm with the dumbbell overhead, fully extended with the palm facing inward. This is your starting position.
Support your extended arm with your free hand holding your upper arm, just above the elbow.
While keeping your upper arm stationary, inhale and lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbow.
Continue lowering until your forearm is parallel to the floor or slightly lower.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Exhale and raise the dumbbell back to the starting position by extending your elbow, focusing on contracting your triceps.
Maintain control throughout the entire movement.
Complete all repetitions with one arm before switching to the other arm.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Triceps Kickback
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and bend forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
Keep your back straight, knees slightly bent, and head in neutral alignment with your spine.
Bend your elbows so your upper arms are parallel to the floor and close to your sides, with forearms pointing toward the floor. This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and extend your elbows by pushing the dumbbells back and up until your arms are fully extended and parallel to the floor.
Focus on contracting your triceps at the top of the movement.
Hold the contracted position briefly.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position by bending your elbows, lowering the dumbbells in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

triceps.name: Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Stand facing a high pulley cable machine with a straight bar or rope attachment.
Grasp the attachment with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at shoulder width.
Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Position your elbows close to your body and bent at approximately 90 degrees. This is your starting position.
While keeping your upper arms stationary against your sides, exhale and push the attachment down by extending your elbows until your arms are fully extended.
Focus on contracting your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
Hold the contracted position briefly.
Inhale and slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner, allowing your elbows to bend to 90 degrees.
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
